column4: CShadowrun, I imagine that's because of copy-protection. A bit of corrupted data that can't be burned..
Unless there's some kind of "raw" burning mode
but it works fine in the emulator

Correct. But your operating system and CD drive don't like to burn corrupted data. (Built-in protections against burn failures). So for you to burn, I would think you would need a way to bypass those built-in protections.
